FuncDef: The send-time command makes a key act as a send key for the specified interval of time. The send-time command makes a key act as a send key for the specified interval of time. By default, no send-time is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the start send time.
In HH:MM format. The value ranges from 00:00 to 23:59.

Specifies the send date.
In YYYY-MM-DD format. The value ranges from 1970-01-01~2050-12-31.

Specifies the duration of the send time in minutes.
The value ranges from 1 to 26280000.

Specifies that the key will be acting as an active send key forever from the configured start-time.
-

Specifies the end send time.
In HH:MM format. The value ranges from 00:00 to 23:59. The end-time should be greater than the start-time.

Specifies the end date.
In YYYY-MM-DD format. The value ranges from 1970-01-01~2050-12-31.

ExtraInfo: Each keychain consists of multiple key IDs that are valid within different time periods and each key ID is configured with an authentication algorithm. When a key ID becomes valid, the corresponding authentication algorithm is used, ensuring the dynamic change of authentication algorithms. Configure different key IDs for packet sending and receiving to be valid within different time periods.
